result.execSummary:
The defendant Trendele T Jordan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 7 1/2 years bifurcated sentence.
Concurrent with: current sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known gang members, drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Once released report to Racine Vocational Ministry and the Fatherhood Program at the YMCA. Cognitive behavior therapy. Comply with family court order. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park

Defendant Trendele T Jordan in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Trendele T Jordan in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Laura Walker
Preliminary hearing at 11-05-2015 08:30 am

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Trendele T Jordan in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Lillian V. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
